clinical_study.brief_title: Cardiac Function in Severe Aneurysmal Subarachnoid Haemorrhage Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Speckle Tracking Assessment of Cardiac Function in Severe Aneurysmal Subarachnoid Haemorrhage and Impact on Neurologic Outcome (SPLASH)

brief_summary.textblock: Cardiac dysfunction can occur in aneurysmal subarachnoid haemorrhage and might impact patient's neurologic outcome Condition Aneurysmal subarachnoid haemorrhage World Neurosurgeon Federation Score ≥ III

detailed_description.textblock: Trans-thoracic echocardiography on day 1, day 3 and day 7 Speckle-Tracking of echocardiographic loops by a cardiologist blinded to the patient's management and outcome

primary_outcome.description: modified Rankin Scale (mRS). Poor neurological outcome was considered as death or severe disability (mRS 5-6).

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between cardiac strain on day 1 and Left Ventricular Ejection fraction
Correlation between cardiac enzymes (NT-proBNP, troponin T US) and cardiac strain
Correlation between EKG findings and cardiac strain

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Intensive Care Unit stay, expected average 17 days
Duration of mechanical ventilation, expected average 15 days
Duration of ICU stay, expected average 17 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between Cardiac function and Mechanical Ventilation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day1, day3, day7 and extubation time expected average 15 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between Cardiac function and ICU length of stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day1, day3, day 7 and end of stay in ICU expected average 17 days

intervention.description: Speckle-Tracking of echocardiographic loops by a cardiologist blinded to the patient's management and outcome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aneurysmal subarachnoid haemorrhage
- World Neurosurgeon Federation Score ≥ III
- Written information to next-of-kin and patients when possible
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of myocardial infarction, chronic heart failure with NYHA ≥ 2, major heart surgery
- Lack of acoustic window to perform trans-thoracic echocardiography
